I am a 56 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 9 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Tom Clancy Rainbow SIX series is a fantastic in-depth experience not to be missed by FPS enthusiasts.
The latest releases need to have more single player involvement to allow all players to immerse themselves in this amazing experience.

The game itself is amazing. Tons of cool operators you can easily unlock that each have cool gadets that help you win the round. The biggest killer to this game and its really just a stake through the heart is that the rounds are heavily unbalanced. Quickmatch you can easily be put against someone who has more than 10x your hours, and will proceed to dominiate over you time and time again, without giving a chance to get better at the game itself. New comer gamemode is no diffrent, you get constantly killed endlessly with your teamates either newbies themselves, and not helping protect the objective or trolls who find it amusing to kill you over and over again getting buddies to join in. This review was from a solo players perspective, but this game as of 6/24/22 is NOT worth the monney. Id recomend getting this game on xbox game pass before you purchase it here.

if the game were to be released how it is today i think it would be a major success. however, after seeing how the game has progressed over the past 7 years, its hard to appreciate this version. seeing the dev team trying to relate to the playerbase has been utterly embarrassing. also not a fan of politics or real world debated issues in video games, and this dev team has started implementing that. literally nobody cares. thats not what this game is about. the new ui compared to the old is horrendous. cheating is still as prevalent as ever, possibly worse. it took over 3 years for a new map. since then theyve been releasing 1 operator every season as opposed to 2, and have some very questionable gadgets that look straight ripped from games like valorant. the game siege that was supposed to be realistic to real world technology has far left that in the past with operators like sens, azami, iana, and melusi. im also all for diversity in video games, but compare the first operators in this game to the current ones and you can see where the devs mind is at; it just adds the unrealisticness. 

i used to watch a lot of r6 content creators since this game came out, and all of them have quit except for a few because of how low the engagement is. every healthy game out there has a strong viewerbase to it. the only thing doing well is the esports section, and even that has fallen off. player counts are surprisingly high, but i wouldn't be surprised if half of them were secondary accounts for cheating. 

for the actual game itself. it requires a massive amount of time to be put into it in order for you to start getting value in games. map knowledge, operator knowledge, and practical mechanic sense is all just as important as actual aim. expect to be utter trash until after putting in like 25 hours. then you can "enjoy" the game.

conclusion: id recommend this game for only new players who want to suffer. sure it's different and unique, but just know it had much greater potential to it. gamebreaking bugs and poor dev decisions forced a large number of players to leave in the past, so dont be surprised when it happens again.

When I first bought Rainbow Six Siege: Starter Edition (back in October 22, 2017), this game was something phenomenal. It wasn't a "tactical" shooter, which was promised back in E3, but it was close to what was presented in the concept. The story of the White Masks was also interesting, and how the tutorials made us, new players, from recruits to experienced players.

The game itself brought together many people, whom turned into a long-lasting friend group. Amazing seasons came out with actual original content, characters and maps. New HUDs, which still somehow kept the same vibe of the old HUD. It was all going well, until the old team left and the new "Team B" arrived. We all had high hopes for something "greater", but it all turned into what we have today.

This is not a semi-tactical shooter anymore, this is just another shooter filled with LGBTQ+ characters, with a dramatic/tragic backstory for no reason whatsoever, to make them seem "special".

Old Siege > New Siege

I love this game. I have over 2000 hours on Xbox, and a little over 50 on PC. The idea of the game is similar to Valorant or CSGO, with it being a 5 vs 5 FPS, without the prep faze buy mechanics that these games include. Rainbow is a lot of fun, but it does come with some bugs. IP leaking and D Dosing are real problems, and PC has some issues with Cheating and Hacking. However, this does not change my love for the game, and I really recommend it for someone looking for an FPS with these types of Mechanics. (PS, it requires a lot of game knowledge and time to get good). Hope you enjoy!

This game is great, but I can't shake the feeling that its not fun to play rn for newcomers.

You can pick up and play. But the people that play this game PLAY this game. Even if I had an aim bot I'd still have trouble. Its a high skill ceiling game and some players can pull off some impressive stuff. So impressive I, without fail, report them for hacking.

Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like military simulators? 
For better or worse, the Tom Clancy vibe is mostly gone from Rainbow Six Siege. It’s less dark and gritty and more vibrant and colorful, mostly for gameplay purposes. Siege is a first-person shooter at heart, the tactics and gadgets augment the shooter mechanics. 

If you’re looking for a game like Squad or ARMA, Siege likely isn’t for you. It was always less of what you wanted in a game from the beginning and is rapidly becoming less of what you want over time. 

Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like military simulators and have played before?
Yes! At its core, Siege is a great game, even if it isn’t bang-on the Tom Clancy branding. If you’re a fan of military simulators, Siege is likely going to be a little fast-paced for your liking, but if you’ve played before you know what you’re getting into.

There are still tons of tactics and gadgets to immerse yourself in — even if the darkness and grittiness that was there from the original games wasn’t all the way there at launch, and is rapidly fading. 

Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I like first-person shooters and am new to the game?

It’s hard to say yes here. Ultimately, Siege is a great experience but is not friendly to new or inconsistent players. There are massive maps, tons of gadgets, and dozens of unique interactions between the operators that aren’t explained well in supplementary content from Ubisoft. 

New players are going to have dozens of hours of headaches before they feel like they really understand what’s going on. The players that have been playing Siege have been playing for upwards of seven years. That’s a lot of experience and work to try and bypass. It is unforgiving, and you’re forced to learn quick or be very bored with the game. 

It’s impossible to recommend R6 to any new player that doesn’t have a lot of patience and a lot of spare time. If you’re a solo player it’s impossible. With friends it’s possible, but you’ll arguably have more fun in another game.

As of the moment I only have a couple of hours into the game but I already have a ton of problems with it.
Firstly the audio is just terrible, you can't tell how far someone is from you, if they're above or below, you'll be just around a wall from someone who was full sprinting and it'll sound the same as any other movement in the game, doesn't get louder.
Additionally there is a bug that continues to happen until the end of your game, ear rape would be putting it kindly, I couldn't hear anything other than the sound of a gun continuously firing, I'd prefer to have a 4 man shooting a negev in my head during warmup on CS:GO than whatever I was hearing. Edit: It only stops for while you're in that match, and will persist until you restart the game.
Second, the ADS time is terrible, we're supposed to be trained soldiers capable of defending or attacking a point of interest, yet it takes you a full second and a half to put the gun to your shoulder and eye? I don't expect snap straight to ADS but I expect it to be there within the second considering that you can tell distance in the game, camping becomes more apparent so having a quicker ADS would at least let you challenge the person. I've had to walk/crouch/sprint while adsing to just even bother to fight back.
Third, the Hip fire is just horrible, what's the point of a crosshair displaying the radius if it isn't correct? I've watched my bullets hit shit that was almost off screen while standing still, not to mention the moment I fired the bullet hadn't even hit the wall within that time frame, at 10 feet away there is no time delay for a bullet to hit a wall, it'd register faster than the eye could perceive.
Fourth, if you come into the game expecting to be able to enjoy the content you see on youtube where you attempt to attack/defend a point of interest, rappel down walls, etc, prepare to be sorely disappointed because the CASUAL/Unranked isn't until level 10... Yes the casual mode is locked until you've played enough deathmatch to hit level 10, honestly I find that to be the most stupid idea I've seen in a FPS game, it makes me feel like you got this idea from League of Legends where they force to you play bots until you hit a certain level.
Honestly I can't recommend this game just yet, I'll continue trying it to see if maybe once I hit 10 I'll at least enjoy the game a bit more, but for the current time I regret having hit the 2 hour mark and not being able to refund the game.

This games, where do I start. I started playing this game years ago, starting off as just a wee young lad back when operation health was all the buzz! It looked like such a fun game, I remember the youtube videos I would watching before I even played the game. Staying up at night watching youtubers such as H20 Delirious and CaRtOoNz. Those videos were what really got me hooked, in fact, I can barely remember the one scene in one of their youtube videos that instantly made me get up from my bed and ask my parents for the game. All I can remember is someone was playing as Doc as the last man standing when they used the stim to give themselves extra health and rushed the enemy team in a last ditch effort, and it was successful. Seeing this astonished me and gave me the hope to do something even close to that. It gave me a goal, a purpose, a reason for everything that I waas about to do. That was just the beginning. That is what planted this seed, what laid this egg that was bound to hatch, and let me tell you.. That caterpillar blossomed into the most beautiful butterfly ever imagined. Throughout years of switching between consoles, friend groups, and even school years. One thing had stayed the same, my favorite game. Siege was always something I was willing to play, of course there were ups and downs and of course I wasnt the best at the game, I never even made it to diamond. But despite all the trials and tribulations, I would always go back to playing siege eventually. Although in recent years that's stopped. I'm playing new games, having different experiences as I grow a learn things. I am making new friendships, relationships, and meeting new people in general. I've changed a lot from the days when i would watch H20 Delirious play this game in its early stages and so has siege. As the game grows, so do I. This game has had its fair shares of troubles such as on console where there would be multiple games in a row where you are getting kicked off your own internet for just being good at the game, to losing streaks with friends just because you were bad at it. But it was always fun and it did keep me invested for many years. Although I am no longer as consistent with playing this game as I used to be, I think I still enjoy it just as much. Siege has been a big part of my growing years and I wouldnt have it any other way. I truly do enjoy this game and I hope the experience I had with this game is relatable to even one person who has played the game.
The best shooting game I have ever played

It feels unfortunate to leave my review for Siege as a negative. I have loved and played all of the R6 games in the series as a huge fan of SWAT based game play. R63 is like one of my favorite titles played in the series, and I was excited to pick it up Siege when they announced it would contain many features that were present in the series. The strategy behind the gameplay made it feel so different from your generic shooters. I do think at a base level the game and the concepts are amazing. The maps are fairly interesting and try very hard to keep wall destruction, grappling and tight entry points a main focus to stay true to Siege's unique gameplay. I love the idea behind it, why the thumbs down? Team Killing. It was far more common than I expected it to be. In a game that is dedicated to teamwork, you opponents can decide to kill you without any real punishment. Reporting does next to nothing, you still usually lose your current game and move to the next match hoping it doesn't happen again. You didn't get shot at spawn? Well now someone doesn't like your placement of a wall or device and they shoot you because "you're griefing." Maybe one of your teamates is an idiot and walks in front of your fire, now you're flagged for team killing and put your team at a disadvantage based on an accident. It is just such an unhealthy mechanic to have in a small group competitive multiplayer game. It's funny when you shoot your sibling in the face playing a coop game, it's not great when it wastes everyone's time and efforts. The only thing people recommend is to find players outside of the game to team up with... Also talking about reporting doing nothing; hacking is such a massive issue in the game. Its not crazy to die from random angles, but when someone tracks your movements through layers of walls during a kill cam you do not feel great playing against them for the rest of the match. I have encountered the hacking issue far less than the team killing. It's also very hard to recommend the game to new players. There is an extreme learning curve introduced in the game. The only tutorials you have will let you understand the basic concepts of the games, but learning a map in and out can take time. It can be very easy to get lost in a map if you're new, let alone learn about what walls to barricade and what operators to bring. You also likely have very few operators because Ubi does not sell operators by the year and not a lot of players will invest heavily for a full roster into a brand new game. I will change my stance if team killing gets addressed (it won't), but I cannot recommend a competitive game that can be ruined so easily.

That being said if you're new to the game don't let people discourage you from learning the maps and ops cause they're are a lot in both categories. Each op is pretty unique in their own way whether its a breaching op, trap op, intel op...etc
Then when it comes to maps the majority of them are great maps and fun to play on but there are also garbage maps as well.....looking at you Yacht....
Continuing off the map subject. This game is like 80% map knowledge and knowledge of what ops are capable of so do not get discouraged if your terrible when you start off. I have also 900hrs in this game and i still have my shit days.
Overall this is definitely one of my favorite games of all time and will continue to be that way.
Year 7 is a big year in terms of content and longevity. There are 3 new maps coming this year 2 of which are already out. 1 being made specifically for ranked/casual and the other being a TDM map. The last one will be coming during season 3 and will be another ranked/casual map which is huge cause siege hasn't seen a new map in around 3 years. Furthermore there is a complete ranked overhaul coming in Y7S3 as well as new ops every season, So you're definitely getting your moneys worth in content.

Rainbow Six Siege where to begin well - 

between console and PC i can say ive got about 2k-2.5k hours on siege because of this here is what i can tell you so far in 7 years of playing

Pros-
- updated regularly like maybe 2 weeks ish to fix bugs and other issues 
- every 3 months new season 1 new operator and new guns or maps depending 
- teamwork is perfect if your wanting to play a strategy game with your friends 
- there is 5 man que you can play solo, 2 players, 3 players, 4 players, 5 players all in 1 team 
- there is a training grounds with easy mode normal mode and veteran 
- there is a ranking system from copper- diamond then there champion level if you want to go really up there
- there is a unranked system if you want to relax and chill out although some will take it just as serious as ranked 
- theres a casual mode for anyone trying to relax and just vibe and learn the game or make new friends 
- can communicate with a mic if you want to callout and help the team 
- there is an all chat and a team chat if you want to talk to the enemies or your team through text 
- different gameplay/ style compared to other games you can lean and hipfire lean and even barricade breach charges and all 
- you have 3 different gamemodes secure area, defend bombs, capture a hostie, and death match, 
- if a tk happens you can give them a tringle and they wont be able to tk again without consequences 
- new gamemodes and events are added during holidays and other special occasions
- yes there are micro-transactions and skins along with alpha packs you get for free playing and a battle-pass and yes you can get most skins in the game for free elite skins are not included but i could be wrong 
- there is also a new shooting range to help better improve aim and ability to know damage with each weapon if your into this on a more detailed level 
-community challenges are also a thing to earn renown to unlock operators or alpha packs to get more skins


Cons- 
-cheaters can literally come up with crazy ideas when cheating so watch out and yes the anti cheat and ubi struggle with banning them 
- toxic teammates can be at random 
- you might get the same lobbies alot depending time of day 
- might have to deal with people not cooperating and helping the team
- might have to deal with audio issues and major bugs 
- might never get the bug you have fixed so be prepared to deal with it till you find a work around or a new season fixes it
- need ubisofts launcher however think this is good because you can level up on Ubisoft and gain cosmetics and other event items added from there other games to this one

Was one of the best/worst competitive shooters out there. If you're still on the fence, it goes on sale quite often for a very good price, but be warned the community is not friendly to new players. You will be team killed in most cases when you don't know your operators meta. To combat the team killing, a new reputation system was implemented which has done more harm than good. The same toxic players that would kill you now instead stand in front of you waiting for you to shoot your weapon and intentionally walk into your bullets to intentionally hurt your reputation. All it takes is 3 toxic people to be in a group together to completely ruin a match and it has genuinely hurt this game in the last few months. I love this game and have put in over a 1000 hours on console along with my 300+ on PC, but in its current state it's hard to recommend this to new players because they will likely be punished for being new. Even if you are a returning player, I can't rightfully recommend it to you either. There has also been a ridiculous amount of cheaters in not only casual lobbies, but unranked/ranked lobbies are also infested with them. I'm afraid to say this game is potentially reaching it's end and the peak of it has most certainly been left behind us.

***NEWBIES*** At least 50%, if not more, of this game is map knowledge. So don't beat yourself up if you're super lost and everyone is yelling at you over game chat. Just mute the salty people and report them if they TK. Trust me there are a lot of people in the game that will back you up and want to help, so don't let one bad experience make you quit the game for good.

There are a LOT of maps to learn and a lot of small details in every one. It's going to take the average person until your siege level is at LEAST 50 before you really start recognizing map layouts and details on all maps - including room orientation, call outs, soft wall, hard wall, what should be reinforced in each site, common paths of travel, etc.. And then probably until 75 until you're actually comfortable with most maps and operators. I'll give 15% to your own gun skills, 20% to team work and communication (call outs call outs call outs, people. Don't be that guy that just looks at memes after dying. Unless it's casual.), and 15% to your knowledge of the operators and ability to utilize their gadgets.

More tips:
-There are a lot of Diamond/Plat smurfs in newcomer that like to make new accounts and s*** on actual new players because it makes them feel good for some reason, so you're better off playing quick match.
-To learn maps faster, make your own custom games and run around in them.
-When you die, make sure you watch the replay so you know what cheeky angle the enemy was holding and then don't do what you did next time, or use it to your advantage when you switch sides.
-If you're not on cams, watch teammates. Look at the places they check as they sweep rooms. Watch the paths they take. Look at how they engage in gun fights and how they rotate around the map.
-Spend the extra few dollars to buy a version with some operators - it'll make game play more fun for you and you'll have an easier time finding operators that work best with your play style.
-Squad up with friends - being able to communicate and laugh in a discord can really improve the game experience, even if it's just one other person.
-Best way to really understand an operator is to play them, so take advantage when there are siege events that allow you to play whoever you want. Use this information to purchase your next operator with the game currency.

Rainbow Six Siege
When we look at video games at times we tend see them with glitches, bugs, lags spikes, and droped frames. So, when we start to think about the designers who made this, we think they had did a bad job at it. Although what most people don’t know about designing video games is that they take forever to make; for example, the game Red Dead Redemption 2 is coming out in the next few weeks and that game has been in the making for the past 11 years and there are still hundreds of bugs in the game. So, when looking at redesigning video games and how they could improve; one will be the game Rainbow Six Siege. Where if I could redesign this game from the ground up it could easily become one of the top 5 games in the world if played right which would be fixing hit registration, reducing toxicity, stopping hackers, redesign operators from the ground up, and to add more Limited Times Modes (LTMS ) in the game.
First off what is Rainbow Six Siege? Rainbow six siege is a FPS video game where anything can be destroyed, there is only one life, and having communication is key to succeed in this game. It is a 5 on 5 player base where the first team to win 3 rounds wins the game. They’re two different aspects when playing this game which are attackers and defenders. Also, each operator brings something unique that the person can use.
So, when redesigning this game from the ground up, one of the most important redesigns I would do is to fix Hit Registration. Hit Registration is when in a game where you the person aims at a person and you shoot the person; and the person who got shot gets a disadvantage by losing health or dying. Also, a player body is the outline of where you can get shot. For example, shooting someone in the foot, hand, and back counts as hit registration. So, one of the problems that there is in this game currently that stops it being one of the top games in the market is the Hit Registration because, they are times were when playing the game it looks like you are shooting the person and blood is coming out but nothing happens and that person turns around and kills you. Another example would be that when you are in the game and you get knocked down to the floor, which is the stage before death “the down but not out stage” where you must be revived to comeback, and at times when getting shot you can see the blood come out but you don’t die or you shoot a down person but they don’t die. I had found multiple solutions to solve this which will be first off would be to add a weapon miss alignment system which is a system where you aim sight is what you shoot because in the current version of the game it doesn’t exist. Say this you are shooting this person directly in your vision but if die by him and see the kill cam it shows that you had missed all your shots. This will dramatically increase Hit Registration and frustration in this game. Another solution that I had was bumping up the frames per second in the game for console to 60-70 frames a second instead of 30-60 frames a second. Where you lag at times when interacting in the game and it freezes you and screws you over in the end. Also adding more servers in this game will play a key factor for hit registration because currently there in only one server in the game and it to many people playing it which at times freezes or lags the game messing up the hit registration.
Another redesign that I would do to this game to improve and succeed more is to reduce the amount of toxicity there is and to stop hackers. This is one of the biggest problems right now in Rainbow Six Siege because when playing this game on PC there is a lot of hackers that makes the game boring, and frustrating. Examples of this would be people teleporting throughout the map and killing everyone, having a shield equip and they turn on wall hacks (which is you know where everyone is at through walls) and they run around the map shooting everyone, and people can’t do nothing because they are invincible. Also, Toxicity is where people in the game who treat their teammates with disrespect like saying inappropriate and racist comments to them, killing their own team mates, shooting them, downing them and so on. For this to be fix is first off is when if a person wants to play the competitive mode of siege they will need to do two step verification system. Where that person had to put in the number or extra email to their account and if that person gets caught cheating he will get banned from his account. The thing is about this system is that after the person account go banned they cannot make another account with that email or number because the system will trace any associated things with the previous account and will ban it and those hackers cannot get anything back even if they bought items on the game. Also to stop hackers in the game once they get caught cheating I would make it for the first time that they could never play the competitive mode again and only casual with a 15 day ban from there account. Then if they get caught again they will become permanently ban from the game. If that person ever wants to the play the game again they will need to start from scratch. Also, to deal with toxicity I will want to make system where if a person team kills in the game everyone else on the team can forgive the teamkill and that person will not be reported for toxicity or if he teamkills again from the round he won’t get kick from the game. Believe me this happens a lot. Then for toxicity the will want to make a system where for the first offense the person is banned from the completive mode( Ranked) for the day, the second offense the person is banned for the day, third offense banned for a week, then a month, then if it happens again the person will be become banned for the next 4 months.
So, let’s talk about Attackers and Defenders and how they work. So when attacking it will be you and 4 other teammates trying to go into the building and neutralize a bomb and take down the enemy’s. For example, you bring a Ying on your team who can throw this grenade that flashes anybody who is in the room that the grenade is toss into. Once flashed people can go into the room plant the bomb and take down anyone who was in the room while they were blinded.
As for defenders it will be you and four other teammates having to battle out any opposing threat and the Defenders must protect the bomb at any cost. An example of this is you bring a Jager on your team who ability is to put down 3 Active Defense Systems where he can destroy any type of grenade. Such as if Ying or Buck try to throw a grenade it will immediately get destroyed helping the defenders.
So another way to make this game better in its future years will be balancing operators, redesigning operators, and adding more Limited Time Modes(LTMS).  But what Rainbow had done to balance her out was reducing damage to her gun, adding Signiant recoil, take away one of her gadgets, and remove her impact grenades. Now today when looking at her data she is in the middle of win rate and pick rate. Also to make this game more attractive to other people and for the game to be played a lot more will be adding more LTMS because it brings something different from the casual play. This will increase attraction because when looking at Fortnite or Call of Duty at least once a week a new LTM comes out or an item keeping the game fresh.

Rainbow 6 changed my life.

The Tom Clancy franchise has been one of my top favorites for years, and I have loved every game they have put out/. I was known among my friends as "the R6 guy". As the game grew with age, so did the developers lack of ingenuity  and lack of care to keep an amazing game credible. You will find die hard fans, pros and content creators who are holding on to a fantasy that this game will one day breath new life. I'd say to download the game when it's on Free to Play weekend however, its a breeding ground for cheaters.

This game actually got me so depressed that it turned me off from gaming in general and made me take a good look at my life, it made me realize that if a game can make me this devastated then I need to make some changes. So I've been doing other things, such as going for walks and hikes regularly, working on personal projects, and improving my life in general. So thank you UBISOFT, for turning a flawless game into  such a terrible game and destroying one of my favorite franchises off all time, it has really improved my life.

So you wanna know about Siege?  I've been playing Siege for about 5 years at the time of posting this and whilst I've not got thousands of hours in the game, I'd say I have a pretty good grasp on the game.

R6 Siege is one of the best FPS games I've ever played to put it simply. The controls and mechanics are the best I have ever seen in any FPS. The fast paced action of the game where any gun can one shot headshot in a 5v5 on a small map makes for some very tense moments in the game. There are plenty of characters (operators) to pick from for both defenders and attackers all with different Primary and Secondary guns along with each having their unique gadget. All this means that you rarely find yourself in a similar match twice.

Now there are plenty of downsides to the game with matchmaking being absolutely scuffed in Ranked and thousands of smurfs running round, along with the mountain of bugs that still need to be patched. Still I'd recommend this game as you could easily get a 100 hours in solo before finding some friends to play with or going online to find a discord server or something.

Awesome game! I grew up playing the other Tom Clancy games, and this one is nothing short of fitting up to to the Tom Clancy name! Low maintenance, good graphics, fun game-play. Sadly-like most other games- Online play can be ruined by a toxic teammate or little kid. All in All a great game. Would recommend.

If you have a friend group and you guys are looking for a competitive experience, I'd definitely suggest this game. I am not the biggest fan of FPS games, as I have always been notoriously bad at them. But the shooting in this game feels so good that I don't mind it. I also feel that with all of these operators available to play in this game, there is a character for everyone. Despite my past complaints concerning this game, I feel like the toxicity this community is known for has died down a lot. I have been solo queuing in this game for days and have not found a single person killing or harassing me. This could be circumstantial, but in my experience siege was good for at least one or two of these incidences daily. My experience these past few weeks have been generally positive. I've even had a lot of fun just chatting with people (Although all of this is subject to change)  Overall, I would recommend the game how it is now and look forward to playing it more with my friends.

The game is pretty fun to play with random people but is the type of game where it is best to form a party of your own friends, with everyone communicating with headsets. It's important to make use of cover, move slowly to not draw attention to yourself, and stick with your team-mates. The various gadgets the operators have mix up the game-play since you need to keep an eye out for various traps.

A Proclamation.

Whereas, on the twenty-second day of September, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-two, a proclamation was issued by the President of the United States, containing, among other things, the following, to wit:

"That on the first day of January, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-three, all persons held as slaves within any State or designated part of a State, the people whereof shall then be in rebellion against the United States, shall be then, thenceforward, and forever free; and the Executive Government of the United States, including the military and naval authority thereof, will recognize and maintain the freedom of such persons, and will do no act or acts to repress such persons, or any of them, in any efforts they may make for their actual freedom.

"That the Executive will, on the first day of January aforesaid, by proclamation, designate the States and parts of States, if any, in which the people thereof, respectively, shall then be in rebellion against the United States; and the fact that any State, or the people thereof, shall on that day be, in good faith, represented in the Congress of the United States by members chosen thereto at elections wherein a majority of the qualified voters of such State shall have participated, shall, in the absence of strong countervailing testimony, be deemed conclusive evidence that such State, and the people thereof, are not then in rebellion against the United States."

Now, therefore I, Abraham Lincoln, President of the United States, by virtue of the power in me vested as Commander-in-Chief, of the Army and Navy of the United States in time of actual armed rebellion against the authority and government of the United States, and as a fit and necessary war measure for suppressing said rebellion, do, on this first day of January, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-three, and in accordance with my purpose so to do publicly proclaimed for the full period of one hundred days, from the day first above mentioned, order and designate as the States and parts of States wherein the people thereof respectively, are this day in rebellion against the United States, the following, to wit:

Arkansas, Texas, Louisiana, (except the Parishes of St. Bernard, Plaquemines, Jefferson, St. John, St. Charles, St. James Ascension, Assumption, Terrebonne, Lafourche, St. Mary, St. Martin, and Orleans, including the City of New Orleans) Mississippi, Alabama, Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, and Virginia, (except the forty-eight counties designated as West Virginia, and also the counties of Berkley, Accomac, Northampton, Elizabeth City, York, Princess Ann, and Norfolk, including the cities of Norfolk and Portsmouth[)], and which excepted parts, are for the present, left precisely as if this proclamation were not issued.

And by virtue of the power, and for the purpose aforesaid, I do order and declare that all persons held as slaves within said designated States, and parts of States, are, and henceforward shall be free; and that the Executive government of the United States, including the military and naval authorities thereof, will recognize and maintain the freedom of said persons.

And I hereby enjoin upon the people so declared to be free to abstain from all violence, unless in necessary self-defence; and I recommend to them that, in all cases when allowed, they labor faithfully for reasonable wages.

And I further declare and make known, that such persons of suitable condition, will be received into the armed service of the United States to garrison forts, positions, stations, and other places, and to man vessels of all sorts in said service.

And upon this act, sincerely believed to be an act of justice, warranted by the Constitution, upon military necessity, I invoke the considerate judgment of mankind, and the gracious favor of Almighty God.

In witness whereof, I have hereunto set my hand and caused the seal of the United States to be affixed.

Done at the City of Washington, this first day of January, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty three, and of the Independence of the United States of America the eighty-seventh.

By the President: ABRAHAM LINCOLN
WILLIAM H. SEWARD, Secretary of State.

1 tablespoon good olive oil

3 cups chopped yellow onions (3 onions)

1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme leaves

2 teaspoons kosher salt

1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce

1/3 cup canned chicken stock or broth

1 tablespoon tomato paste

2 1/2 pounds ground chuck (81 percent lean)

1/2 cup plain dry bread crumbs (recommended: Progresso)

2 extra-large eggs, beaten

1/2 cup ketchup (recommended: Heinz) Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Heat the olive oil in a medium saute pan. Add the onions, thyme, salt, and pepper and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, for 8 to 10 minutes, until the onions are translucent but not brown. Off the heat, add the Worcestershire sauce, chicken stock, and tomato paste. Allow to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the ground chuck, onion mixture, bread crumbs, and eggs, and mix lightly with a fork. Don't mash or the meat loaf will be dense. Shape the mixture into a rectangular loaf on a sheet pan covered with parchment paper. Spread the ketchup evenly on top. Bake for 1 to 1 1/4 hours, until the internal temperature is 160 degrees F and the meat loaf is cooked through. (A pan of hot water in the oven, under the meat loaf, will keep the top from cracking.) Serve hot.

Scramble your eggs: Using a small pat of butter, scramble some eggs in a large sauté pan, breaking them into small pieces as you go. Then transfer the eggs to a separate plate, and set aside.
Sauté your veggies and garlic: Return your sauté pan to the heat, and sauté the onions, carrots, peas and garlic until soft and cooked through.
Stir fry rice: Then turn the burner to high heat. Scooch the veggies over to one side of the pan, melt the remaining butter in the other half, and add the chilled rice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce (if using). Then stir to combine with the veggies and continue sautéing the rice, stirring every 15-20 seconds or so for 3 minutes, or until you notice the rice and veggies starting to brown slightly.
Remove pan from heat. And stir in your green onions, sesame oil, and scrambled eggs.
Taste and season. Give the rice a taste, and season with salt and pepper, plus any extra soy sauce or sesame oil if needed.
Serve! Then dish it up and serve nice and warm!

Now, I'm addicted to this game like any other smuck who can't stop playing with toxic relationships (half the community for example), but the longer I play the worse a time I have. Casual used to be fun, now it's Quick Match and everyone actually takes it seriously -is that not what unranked and ranked are for? Hit registration is wonky (headshots don't count as headshots like 40-60% of the time, Kali 50/50 on downing someone when she's within range for it, shooting through hardwalls/cover, grenades hitting teammates through a solid floor or ceiling, etc.) 

I also do not agree with giving operators secondary gadgets that are several hard breaches or thatcher's emps. If they keep that up, no operator will be unique in the ways that makes them important for the gameplay, and they wouldn't need to be played and possibly change the meta or keep a train going to where everyone can do everything, "we should play the same characters every time because we win." 

Asking friends if they think the game is fun anymore, some answers are along the lines of: "only if I'm drunk", "I just play the game to suck richards", :no, it makes me realize life is just as bad as this game", "it hasn't been fun in 7 years they need to try harder".

The state of this game is very, very different from when I first began playing in 2015, so I think it would be good for me to leave a review explaining the pros and cons of siege, and the differences between the old and new states of the game I love so dearly. 

[b][i] TL:DR; [/i][/b] [b]If you're looking for a strictly tactical video game, then this game is probably no longer your best bet. If you're looking for a more realistic team based hero shooter with fun and interesting utility, then this is the game for you![/b]

[h1] The Basics [/h1]

Siege used to be a strictly tactical game with (mostly) realistic tools to assist in gunfights, called gadgets,  and a focus on realism and team based coordination, which released a new map and two new ops each season. Now, Siege is a loosely tactical game with semi-futuristic gadgets with one new op each season and a new map intermittently, along with updates to old maps. 

[b] Pros: [/b]
-Very fun game overall
-Gameplay is interesting
-Diverse operator abilities allows for any playstyle
-Active development and anti-cheat

Cons:
-Toxic community, especially towards LGBTQ+ and Minority folks
-Hard to pick up and get into immediately
-Complicated maps and loadouts

[h1] My Personal Opinion [/h1]

I began playing siege when I was looking for a fun, interesting and realistic tactical team based shooter to partake in, and it fulfilled this role at that time. Now, I find myself unable to enjoy Siege for realism purposes, as it's jumped the shark into holograms, magical bullets, and invincible plexiglass. I would be remiss, however, if I did not mention how fun this truly is. If you stop taking the game seriously and just enjoy it for what it is, siege will never stop being fun for you, lord knows it hasn't for me.

This game is just such an experience, from the tactical gameplay and unique operators based on real life events and actual tactical units like 707th smb or the GIGN. they put time into minute details which is just astonishing. The first person teamwork based shooter, completely relying on skill, and teamwork, and audio cues too. its a breath of fresh air from the over saturated shooter market, where everyone is copying to big thing, siege does it different. its a beautiful experience to go through. There is a learning curve tho and has a amazing community and is available on all the major gaming platforms (PS4, XBOX,P.C.). For anyone as well using reviews to make a decision on buying this game, then id say its worth it. the ingame store is also amazing, unlike fortnite, call of duty or any other shooting game, you can almost buy every thing in the store with renown, which you get around 100-200 per game. But, for a shorter route you can buy the skins headgear or weapon skins for a couple of what is called r6 credits which are cheap, (to give you an idea with twenty bucks you can get 4 operators, which  is the equivalent of one fortnite skin.

the game is generally enjoyable solo and with friends, but once you decide to start playing competitively, people begin to get a bit toxic. I have played this game on console since 2015 and have not stopped having fun. the seasonal updated add new things to the game and new things to progress towards, which helps keep my interest. Remember that this is a game and is meant to be fun. The player decides when and if they are going to have fun by helping their teammates and working towards a common goal. Have fun.

Rainbow Six Siege is one of the most popular — and complex — first-person shooters on the current games market. A blend of milsim games and round-based tactical shooters like Counter-Strike, Rainbow Six exists in a niche that no other game truly fits into. 

"Should you play Rainbow Six Siege?" Well, that answer is complicated. Siege has had seven years and has many moving parts. Let’s divide it up into the varying types of players. 

For better or worse, the Tom Clancy vibe is mostly gone from Rainbow Six Siege. It’s less dark and gritty and more vibrant and colorful, mostly for gameplay purposes. Siege is a first-person shooter at heart, the tactics and gadgets augment the shooter mechanics. 

If you’re looking for a game like Squad or ARMA, Siege likely isn’t for you. It was always less of what you wanted in a game from the beginning and is rapidly becoming less of what you want over time. 

Yes! At its core, Siege is a great game, even if it isn’t bang-on the Tom Clancy branding. If you’re a fan of military simulators, Siege is likely going to be a little fast-paced for your liking, but if you’ve played before you know what you’re getting into.

There are still tons of tactics and gadgets to immerse yourself in — even if the darkness and grittiness that was there from the original games wasn’t all the way there at launch, and is rapidly fading. 

It’s hard to say yes here. Ultimately, Siege is a great experience but is not friendly to new or inconsistent players. There are massive maps, tons of gadgets, and dozens of unique interactions between the operators that aren’t explained well in supplementary content from Ubisoft. 

New players are going to have dozens of hours of headaches before they feel like they really understand what’s going on. The players that have been playing Siege have been playing for upwards of seven years. That’s a lot of experience and work to try and bypass. It is unforgiving, and you’re forced to learn quick or be very bored with the game. 

It’s impossible to recommend R6 to any new player that doesn’t have a lot of patience and a lot of spare time. If you’re a solo player it’s impossible. With friends it’s possible, but you’ll arguably have more fun in another game. 

Should I play Rainbow Six Siege if I played before but took a year off?
By all standards, Rainbow Six Siege is in one of the best states of its life cycle. Yes, if you have experience in the game, jump on in, the water’s fine.

I am a 59 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 40 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching Ukrainian men French kissing canines on YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

The community is so ass and whiny but that's not the games fault. The game itself is fun and I love the guns. The characters are memorable and so easy to remember. But with so many characters it's not that easy for new players to join since there's a lot to unload onto them. The main gripe I have is the amount of Traps they will have to deal with going into the game. Not knowing how to look, find, or destroy them.
I love this game so much but I cannot say it's an easy game to play properly, but there is a lot of crutches you can abuse. The whole high RPM meta is a good example since it really relies on one head-shot from a huge volley of bullets going into a general direction. Any kind of head-shot will kill so it doesn't even need to be planned or predicted. With the whole one shot head-shot mechanic it really changes the game from a Tactical FPS to a TDM when in any rank with the wrong mindset.
When there are those moments where people actually play for the objective and stick to their roles it's so satisfying as well.
I am showing a lot of negatives with little positives and giving this a recommend rating but I am stuck to this game. I cannot give it up and I won't. Too much time, effort, and money dedicated to it. I only will say if you want to dedicate yourself to learn something I would say there is a lot to learn in this game.

I REALLY DON'T KNOW IF I SHOULD GIVE THIS GAME A THUMB UP OR A THUMB DOWN, SO YOU GUYS CAN JUST READ THE COMMENTS AND IGNORE THE RATING THAT I GAVE TO THIS GAME.

I started playing this game when Ace and Melusi came out, so basically I started playing this game pretty late, but the thing is, once you started knowing the tempo of the game and what you should do and the map and you have to have high IQ, the game could become a very good choice. My highest rank was Gold 2 and I am writing this review from my heart.

Ubisoft is making the game worse and worse, they are having less and less ideas of new operators so that there was only one new operator in a new season since Zero, and the game is becoming less and less realistic than what it should be, operators are having more and more fancy and unrealistic gadgets and abilities, operator skins for this game is getting more and more stupid, Imagine you are expected the game to be like real life but in fact you are fighting against a person wears Rick and Morty or Samurai outfit. Dead bodies are removed and a mark is left on the corpse to indicate the operator. How can you call this game real?

Seriously I don't really care about if the game is realistic or not because I like the destroying and reinforcing system in this game which will make each round different, but at least, let me know which operator it is hen I saw the skin. HOW THE F**K AM I SUPPOSE TO KNOW WHICH OPERATOR IT IS BEHIND A SAMURAI MASK!!!!!! KNOWING THE OPERATOR DURING THE GUN FIGHT IS A VERY IMPORTANT INFORMATION BECAUSE YOU WILL KNOW HOW TO PREVENT THIS OPERATOR, but if buying a fancy skin can make your enemy not recognizing your character, I can tell this game is a pay to win game.

I guess the producer of this game is trying to make the game into a competitive game so that they can appeal more players. They added so many stuffs on the screen to that there are less conversation going on during the game, they are currently trying everything they can to appeal to new players since many players choose not to play this game because of the difficulty and unfriendliness for new player. But the core of this game is that people really need to put their works into it in order to become better. Every Siege player put so much works and efforts into this game such as memorizing the map, knowing different strategies, knowing different operators and learning different ways to get kills by getting killed. This is why we love this game because we grew from a person who doesn't know anything to someone who can eventually getting an ACE and cooperating with teammates. Seriously making these changes won't do s**t to new players, if they don't want to put efforts in, then they won't play the game anyway, if someone really wants to play well in this game or love this game, they will still putting efforts in no matter what. So it really DON'T DO SHIT!

I really want this game to be better and I really hope that Ubisoft can make some changes to this game and make it more realistic and friendly to our old players. We all want to see everyone play R6 Siege because we all know how good this game is when we play it. I have been suggesting this game to a lot of people I know but a lot of them gave up at the end due to the NEW PLAYER HELL. it is very sad to see this game getting less and less players and they just started selling fancy skins to players because I think the game lost its soul, it is not the Rainbow Six Siege the we all love because of all these dumb changes. I currently stopped playing this game because I am done compromising with this game. All these changes were touching my line and I endured most of them for a long time. The moment when I stopped playing this game is when the Samurai and Rick & Morty skin came out, I was literally showing the picture to one of my friend who always play rainbow six siege with me and asked him to recognize different operators and he can't .

At the End. Since I stopped playing this game, I am currently playing Apex Legends which is much more trending, even I don't play Siege anymore, I still don't want to uninstall it because from my heart, I still believe that siege could become better than this in the future even the hope is so tiny that even I can't really see it. But I will definitely play this game if the game becomes better in my opinion.

The game reflects the need to clear every angle properly like in CQB and the complex gameplay results in every match being refreshing and containing something new to learn about. However toxicity of the game do exists and is not really that new player friendly. Overall though cool game
